questions.question_text: Which of the following settings must be configured in an NSX environment before enabling stateful active-active SNAT?

choices.B: Tier-1 gateway in distributed only mode
choices.D: An Interface Group for the NSX Edge uplinks
choices.A: A Punting Traffic Group for the NSX Edge uplinks

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: D
D is the Answer. Need an Interface group for stateful services (including SNAT) on T-0 active-active gateway. 
https://docs.vmware.com/en/VMware-NSX/4.1/administration/GUID-37BE3A32-C4CA-4C31-80E0-7B8D2889D96A.html

Selected Answer: D
Reference: 
https://vxplanet.com/2023/01/24/nsx-4-0-1-stateful-active-active-gateway-part-1-single-tier-routing/
https://blogs.vmware.com/networkvirtualization/2022/11/enhanced-nsx-edge.html/

Selected Answer: D
Stateful active-active introduces the requirement for an Interface Group to which stateful services, such as NAT, are applied.
The stateful active-active interface group has the following requirements:
• The Interface Group has exactly one interface from every edge node in the edge cluster.
• A separate Interface Group is required for each uplink interface on an edge.
• For Edges with two uplinks, two Interface Groups are required
• In the scenario, each edge has one uplink interface, and one interface group is required.

Selected Answer: AD
A & D as of 4.1 
https://docs.vmware.com/en/VMware-NSX/4.1/installation/GUID-898099FC-4ED2-4553-809D-B81B494B67E7.html#:~:text=Within%20a%20single%20NSX%20Edge%20cluster%2C%20all%20NSX,different%20sizes%20within%20the%20same%20NSX%20Edge%20cluster.

Selected Answer: AD
10 Nodes max and within a single NSX Edge cluster, all NSX Edge nodes must be the same type – either physical servers (bare metal) or VMs

Selected Answer: AD
10 Nodes max and Can only contain one type

Selected Answer: AD
A & D
https://docs.vmware.com/en/VMware-NSX/4.1/installation/GUID-898099FC-4ED2-4553-809D-B81B494B67E7.html
in the Note:
Within a single NSX Edge cluster, all NSX Edge nodes must be the same type – either physical servers (bare metal) or VMs.
Answer: AC

Answer: A
ICM 4.0 course.
An NSX Edge cluster is formed by a group of edge nodes and has the following characteristics:
Provides extra resources to scale out.
Provides high availability.
Supports up to 10 edge nodes, and a maximum of 160 clusters can be configured.
Failure domains can be defined within an edge cluster.

comments.content:
"10 Edge nodes per cluster", but the link is wrong:
https://configmax.esp.vmware.com/guest?vmwareproduct=VMware%20NSX&release=NSX-T%20Data%20Center%203.2.3&categories=17-31

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: AC
Reference: https://configmax.vmware.com/guest?vmwareproduct=NSX-T%20Data%20Center&release=NSX-T%20Data%20Center%203.0.0&categories=17-0
https://docs.vmware.com/en/VMware-NSX-T-Data-Center/3.0/installation/GUID-14183A62-8E8D-43CC-92E0-E8D72E198D5A.html

A, C
An nsx-t edge cluster can have up to 10 edge nodes

choices.A: Can have a maximum of 10 edge nodes
choices.C: Can contain multiple types of edge nodes (VM or bare metal)
choices.D: Must contain only one type of edge nodes (VM or bare metal)
choices.B: Can have a maximum of 8 edge nodes
choices.E: Must have only active-active edge nodes

questions.question_text: Which two statements describe the characteristics of an Edge Cluster in NSX? (Choose two.)

discussion.content: There are only Overlay segments and VLAN segments. Where bridge segments? that is an edge feature
answer should be C
bridge-backed segment provides layer 2 connectivity to overlay

Selected Answer: B
Reference: https://rutgerblom.com/2020/10/26/bridge-your-way-to-nsx-t-overlay/

questions.question_text:
An NSX administrator would like to create an L2 segment with the following requirements:

• L2 domain should not exist on the physical switches.
• East/West communication must be maximized as much as possible.

Which type of segment must the administrator choose?
Which two BGP configuration parameters can be configured in the VRF Lite gateways? (Choose two.)

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: AD
I checked directly from UI. " A & D "

this questions is VRF lite GWs and its A+D and confirmed in the GUI.

B - Route Distribution is incorrect for two reasons. Firstly its Route Re-Distribution, secondly its not nested under BGP configuration but exists at the same hierarchy as it.

Selected Answer: AD
route (re-)distribution is not an option under BGP section in UI

Selected Answer: AD
NSX 4.0 does not allow Local AS override. With NSX version 4.1 you can inherit or override it. Tricky question...

 A) Route Aggregation and and D) BGP neighbours are available when configuring BGP in a VRF.
"Route distribution" does not exist, what you can do is a "Route Re-Distribution" via BGP.

https://docs.vmware.com/en/VMware-NSX/4.1/administration/GUID-4CB5796A-1CED-4F0E-ADE0-72BF7B3F762C.html

Selected Answer: BD
Route Distribution & BGP Neighbors
https://docs.vmware.com/en/VMware-NSX/4.0/administration/GUID-4CB5796A-1CED-4F0E-ADE0-72BF7B3F762C.html
AD is correct - In BGP

Route Distribution & BGP Neighbors

https://docs.vmware.com/en/VMware-NSX-T-Data-Center/3.2/administration/GUID-4CB5796A-1CED-4F0E-ADE0-72BF7B3F762C.html

Selected Answer: D
D 
https://docs.vmware.com/en/VMware-NSX/4.0/administration/GUID-DF689847-252E-451E-84B5-DB507CC010AC.html

Selected Answer: D
Reference: https://docs.vmware.com/en/VMware-NSX-Data-Center-for-vSphere/6.4/com.vmware.nsx.admin.doc/GUID-FD74058A-B473-4B79-9F50-357DED11649A.html

questions.question_text: In which VPN type are the Virtual Tunnel interfaces (VTI) used?
